document_title: Rubella (German measles): Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
To date, there is still no specific medicine to treat Rubella. In many cases, the symptoms of the disease are mild, the patient only needs to rest, drink plenty of water and use fever-reducing medicine when the body temperature increases.
Pregnant women with Rubella need to see a doctor for medical treatment (such as acetaminophen to reduce symptoms). Or in more serious cases, treatment may include blood transfusions or steroids (synthetic hormones that treat inflammation).
